name: Paan'uri
summary: Dark matter entities

name: Pak, aka Protectors
summary: Humanoid, with three distinct life stages. First stage: Child, Second Stage: Breeder (known on earth as Homo Erectus), Third Stage: Protector, (superintelligent, could not survive on Earth).

name: Pas'utu'ril
summary: Six-legged aliens hailing from a large ringed planet outside the Terragen Sphere. Communicate through changing color patterns on their skin.

name: Pemalites
summary: Dog-like aliens, extremely friendly

name: The People from the Home
source: Ingathering: The Complete People Stories by Zenna Henderson
summary: Very like Earth people, but have paranormal powers. Some came to live in small communities on Earth, after their own planet, "the Home", was destroyed.

name: Pequeninos
source: Orson Scott Card's Speaker for the Dead

name: Perry the Living Island of Insight
Petrosapien
summary: A race of silicon-based aliens, they mostly resemble humanoids made out of pale-green/blue crystals. They hail from the planet Petropia, and are able to manipulate crystal to a great extent, and can also shapeshift their bodies so as to form sharp blades out of their bodies. However, they were almost totally extinct for most of the original series, owing to a young Tetrax Shard betraying his people and handing the galactic warlord Vilgax a sacred crystal that he used to destroy Petropia. However, in "The Secret of Chromastone" in Ben 10: Alien Force, it is revealed that the crystal Tetrax stole was a backup for the entire planet and its people, and he and Ben managed to restore the planet and resurrect the Petrosapien race.

name: Phagors
summary: Humanoid

name: Phosphorescent Maze Midgets
summary: Midgets who live in the Lavarynth

name: Pierson's Puppeteers
source: Larry Niven's Ringworld and Known Space series
summary: Three legs, armless, two manipulative heads, brain in torso. Evolved from herbivorous herd animals. Most technologically advanced species in Known Space.

name: Pilots
summary: Crustaceanoid

name: Pisciss Premanns
summary: Little is known about what they truly look like, as the only confirmed individual of this species, the bounty hunter Kraab, had 95% of his body replaced with cybernetics due to injuries sustained in a war between his home planet Piscciss and the Pyronite home star Pyros. However, it can be assumed that Kraab built his mechanical body to resemble his original organic one, indicating that Premann resemble large Earth crabs with humanoid features.

name: Pisciss Volann
summary: Fish-like aliens from the oceanic planet Piscciss, they are similar to several Earth marine creatures, such as alligators, sharks, and anglerfish. That have a luminescent dangle, the ability to withstand increased amounts of pressure, and the ability to swim at great speeds by combining their legs into a tail, making them resemble a merman. They are also voracious eaters, able to unhinge their jaws to bite into much larger objects and even rip through steel.

name: Pkunk
summary: Toucan or dodo-like

name: Planet Duo people
summary: Humanoid

name: Planet Jackers
summary: The Planet Jackers' planet orbits a dying sun, so to keep it alive, they steal planets and hurl them into the sun to keep it burning.

name: Plerkappi
summary: An aquatic animal native to Home and another delicacy by the Race.

name: Plookesians
summary: A peaceful race. Most notable of the Plookesians are Mooshy and Spoopty.

name: Plorgonarians
summary: One-eyed, two-tongued, three-legged, squid-like creatures with green skin, narrow bodies, three fingers on each hand, and an antenna on top of their heads that functions as both a nose and an ear, and turns orange as they age. Their home planet, Plorgonar, resembles the head of a Plorgonarian when seen from space.

name: Pnume
source: Jack Vance's Planet of Adventure series
summary: Insectoid

name: Porquinhos
source: Orson Scott Card's Speaker for the Dead
summary: Humanoid

name: Posleen
source: John Ringo's Legacy of the Aldenata

name: Precursors
summary: Highly advanced, 15 meter tall, eurypterid beings

name: The Prin
source: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's The Lost World
summary: Humanoids with red skin and highly advanced technology with a weakness to Earth's atmosphere

name: Prince
summary: Vampire-humanoids

name: Promethians
summary: Humanoid; formidable ancient race of mysterious origin; reside primarily on Phase World, center of the Three Galaxies; possess "phase" powers, enabling manipulation of physical and dimensional space; generally indifferent to anything that does not pose a threat to themselves or the cosmos as a whole.

name: Proteans
summary: Morphing metallic blobs

name: Protoss
summary: The Protoss are depicted as a physically strong sapient humanoid species with access to advanced psionic abilities.

name: Prypiatosian-B
summary: A particular radioactive alien species who have to wear a heavy and bulky furnace-like armour, which is almost indestructible, to protect external life from themselves. They come form the planet Prypiatos in the Andromeda Galaxy, and have the ability to create and manipulate heat rays, with the ability of overheat their armour. Outside of it, they can fly at very high speeds and absorb huge amounts of energy, even from nuclear reactors.

name: Psions
summary: Thinly-framed humanoid cyclopes with psionic abilities. Were once a slave race to the Cabal empire, but are now seen as equal.

name: Psirens
summary: Shape-changing GELFs

name: Psychlos
summary: Humanoid

name: Psychons
summary: Humanoid with metamorphosis abilities, capable of "molecular transformation" into the form of organic material such as an animal or plant by knowing its molecular structure. This form can only be held for one hour, and they cannot change directly from one form to another.

name: The Puppet Masters
source: Robert A. Heinlein book of the same name

name: Pyrians
summary: Methane-breathing squid-like race

name: Pyronite
summary: Magma-based humanoids from the star Pyros, who possess pyrokinetic (fire manipulation) abilities and are immune to high levels of heat. Since they have little contact with other species, they spend their whole lives perfecting their abilities, further detailed in the reboot series as engagement in extreme sports like windsurfing and dune buggy racing.

name: Pyroviles
summary: Humanoid rock-like aliens from Pyrovilia resembling golems in the form of Roman soldiers wearing Corinthian helmets. They are capable of converting humans into more of themselves much like an infection. Some of them appeared in Pompeii around the time of Mount Vesuvius' eruption in an attempt to repopulate Earth, only to be foiled by the Doctor.
